Articles.Content:
So I jumped in my favourite craft, orbitted Kerbin and set my autopilot to land at 0 0\' 0'N 0 0\' 0'E just to see where the heck that was.

Autopilot landed bang on target and guess what I found there - I landed beside some of my debris from a previous mission that had been sitting there for weeks no more than 340m away!

That debris had de-orbitted, burnt through the atmosphere and through random chance landed exactly at 0 0\' 0'N 0 0\' 0'E.

THAT CAN\'T HAPPEN!
The fact that the random landing happened once makes me wonder how much debris is littered around your world to make that chance a possibility.
My avatar about sums this up.

> 
> The fact that the random landing happened once makes me wonder how much debris is littered around your world to make that chance a possibility.

Quite a bit of debris (this shot is AFTER I\'ve cleaned some of it up!) but I wouldn\'t say excessive ...

That\'s actually a bug, sometimes the data gets screwed up and inputs all zeroes.
Except its not this time. I flew to 0 0 0 and found i was not alone ... THAT CANT HAPPEN!
No, sometimes debris teleports to 0 0 0, because it is all 0s
I also had debris that teleported there. Maybe that\'s the lite version of the NaN bug...
I\'ve also noticed that occasionally some of my debris will be relocated there... for no reason :/
